comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content: Though this aircraft looks very familiar, the registration, NX326M, is a dead end. The engine appears to be a Kinner B-5. At first I thought it might be an early prototype version of a General Western P-2-S Meteor with a smaller engine, but although the struts are similar, the wing shape, landing gear, and tail are different. This reg shows up only as a Cessna CG-2 glider, but this later re-use of 326M is totally absent from any searchable listings I know. Searching numerous books yields nothing.
